intro: Tetraria cuspidata, commonly known as the slender tetraria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sun. The plant is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable component of its ecological habitat.
